abstract: Bank of America Chairman and Chief Executive Kenneth D. Lewis said it may take several quarters for the bank to repay its $45 billion of federal bailout money, although he believes the United States economy may bottom out in the second half of this year.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America Chairman and Chief Executive Kenneth D. Lewis said it may take several quarters for the bank to repay its $45 billion of federal bailout money, although he believes the United States economy may bottom out in the second half of this year.

headline.main: BofA Says Repaying Loan Will Take Time

abstract: Bank of America has reportedly lost yet another senior Merrill Lynch banker.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America has reportedly lost yet another senior Merrill Lynch banker.

headline.main: BofA Said to Lose Another Top Merrill Banker

abstract: Financial institutions have out-borrowed American households, and their indebtedness is still growing even as consumer debt starts to fall.
snippet: Financial institutions have out-borrowed American households, and their indebtedness is still growing even as consumer debt starts to fall.
lead_paragraph: FIFTY years after executives at Bank of America had a clever idea  issue credit cards to ordinary consumers  the leveraging of America may finally be over. The amount owed by consumers, in relation to the entire American economy, has started to fall.

headline.main: Who’s Most Indebted? Banks, Not Consumers
headline.print_headline: Who’s Most Indebted? Banks, Not Consumers
